services.name: LiteLLM
services.description: Unified API gateway for LLM providers
services.abstract: Call 100+ LLM APIs using OpenAI format
services.summary: LiteLLM is a unified API gateway that allows you to call 100+ LLM APIs using the OpenAI format. It provides load balancing, fallbacks, spend tracking, and virtual keys.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n ai -l app.kubernetes.io/name=litellm --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Open WebUI
services.abstract: Self-hosted AI interface supporting multiple model providers
services.summary: Open WebUI is an extensible, feature-rich, and user-friendly self-hosted AI interface. It supports various LLM runners including Ollama and OpenAI-compatible APIs.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n ai -l app.kubernetes.io/name=open-webui --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Authentik
services.abstract: Open-source identity provider with SSO, MFA, and user management
services.summary: Authentik is an open-source Identity Provider focused on flexibility and versatility. It supports SAML, OAuth/OIDC, LDAP, and proxy authentication with built-in MFA support.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n authentik -l app.kubernetes.io/name=authentik --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Nginx
services.abstract: High-performance web server and reverse proxy
services.summary: Nginx is a high-performance HTTP server and reverse proxy, known for its stability, rich feature set, simple configuration, and low resource consumption.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app.kubernetes.io/name=nginx --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Whoami
services.abstract: Lightweight test container for debugging ingress and authentication
services.summary: Whoami is a tiny Go webserver that prints OS information and HTTP request details. Its useful for testing ingress configurations, authentication flows, and debugging network issues.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app=whoami --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: MongoDB
services.abstract: General purpose document database
services.summary: MongoDB is a document-oriented NoSQL database designed for high-volume data storage. It stores data in flexible, JSON-like documents, meaning fields can vary from document to document.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app=mongodb --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: MySQL
services.abstract: Popular open-source relational database for web applications
services.summary: MySQL is the worlds most popular open-source relational database management system. It powers many of the most accessed applications including Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app.kubernetes.io/name=mysql --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: PostgreSQL
services.abstract: Worlds most advanced open-source relational database
services.summary: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open-source object-relational database system with over 35 years of active development. It has earned a strong reputation for reliability, feature robustness, and performance.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app.kubernetes.io/name=postgresql --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Qdrant
services.abstract: High-performance vector database for AI applications
services.summary: Qdrant is a vector similarity search engine and database designed for AI applications. It provides extended filtering support, making it useful for neural network or semantic-based matching.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app.kubernetes.io/name=qdrant --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Redis
services.abstract: In-memory data structure store for caching and messaging
services.summary: Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store used as a database, cache, message broker, and streaming engine. It supports various data structures like strings, hashes, lists, and sets.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app.kubernetes.io/name=redis --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: JupyterHub
services.abstract: Multi-user server for Jupyter notebooks enabling collaborative data science
services.summary: JupyterHub is a multi-user server that manages and proxies multiple instances of Jupyter notebooks. It enables teams to share computational environments and collaborate on data science projects.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n jupyterhub -l app=jupyterhub --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Apache Spark
services.description: Unified analytics engine for big data
services.abstract: Fast and general-purpose cluster computing system for big data processing
services.summary: Apache Spark is a unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing. It provides high-level APIs in Java, Scala, Python, and R, and supports SQL queries, streaming data, machine learning, and graph processing.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n spark-operator -l app.kubernetes.io/name=spark-kubernetes-operator --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Unity Catalog
services.abstract: Open-source data catalog for unified governance across data and AI assets
services.summary: Unity Catalog is an open-source data catalog that provides unified governance for data and AI assets. It enables fine-grained access control, data lineage tracking, and metadata management across your data lakehouse.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n unity-catalog -l app=unity-catalog,component=server --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: ArgoCD
services.abstract: Declarative GitOps CD for Kubernetes
services.summary: ArgoCD is a declarative, GitOps continuous delivery tool for Kubernetes. It automates the deployment of applications to specified target environments, keeping them synchronized with their Git repository definitions.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n argocd -l app.kubernetes.io/name=argocd-server --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Gravitee
services.abstract: Open-source API management platform for designing, deploying, and managing APIs
services.summary: Gravitee is an open-source API management platform that helps you design, deploy, and manage APIs. It provides a gateway, management console, and developer portal for comprehensive API lifecycle management.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n gravitee -l app.kubernetes.io/name=gravitee --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: pgAdmin
services.abstract: Web administration interface for PostgreSQL
services.summary: pgAdmin is a feature-rich open source administration and development platform for PostgreSQL. It provides a graphical interface for managing databases, running queries, and monitoring server activity.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app.kubernetes.io/name=pgadmin4 --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: RedisInsight
services.abstract: Visual management interface for Redis
services.summary: RedisInsight is a visual tool for managing Redis databases. It provides a graphical interface for browsing keys, running commands, monitoring performance, and managing Redis data structures.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app.kubernetes.io/name=redisinsight --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Grafana
services.abstract: Observability platform for metrics, logs, and distributed tracing
services.summary: Grafana is the open-source analytics and monitoring solution for every database. Create, explore, and share dashboards with your team and foster a data-driven culture.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n monitoring -l app.kubernetes.io/name=grafana --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Loki
services.abstract: Horizontally-scalable log aggregation system
services.summary: Loki is a horizontally-scalable, highly-available, multi-tenant log aggregation system inspired by Prometheus. It indexes labels, not log content, making it cost-effective and easy to operate.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n monitoring -l app.kubernetes.io/name=loki --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: OpenTelemetry Collector
services.abstract: Vendor-agnostic telemetry collection and processing
services.summary: The OpenTelemetry Collector offers a vendor-agnostic implementation to receive, process, and export telemetry data. It removes the need to run multiple agents/collectors.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n monitoring -l app.kubernetes.io/name=opentelemetry-collector --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Prometheus
services.description: Metrics collection and storage for observability
services.abstract: Time-series database for metrics collection, storage, and alerting
services.summary: Prometheus is a systems monitoring and alerting toolkit that collects metrics from configured targets, stores them locally, and provides a powerful query language (PromQL) for analysis and alerting.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n monitoring -l app.kubernetes.io/name=prometheus --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Tempo
services.abstract: Open source distributed tracing backend
services.summary: Tempo is an open source, easy-to-use, high-scale distributed tracing backend. It requires only object storage to operate and integrates seamlessly with Grafana, Prometheus, and Loki.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n monitoring -l app.kubernetes.io/name=tempo --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Cloudflare Tunnel
services.abstract: Secure outbound-only tunnel to expose services via Cloudflare
services.summary: Cloudflare Tunnel creates a secure, outbound-only connection between your origin and Cloudflares edge. No need to open public inbound ports - traffic is routed through Cloudflares network.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app=cloudflared --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Tailscale Tunnel
services.abstract: Zero-config WireGuard-based mesh VPN for secure remote access
services.summary: Tailscale creates a secure, private network between your servers, computers, and cloud instances using WireGuard encryption. It provides zero-config networking with built-in NAT traversal.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n tailscale -l app=operator --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: RabbitMQ
services.abstract: Reliable message broker supporting multiple messaging protocols
services.summary: RabbitMQ is a reliable and mature messaging broker that supports multiple messaging protocols including AMQP. It provides features like message persistence, delivery acknowledgment, and flexible routing.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app.kubernetes.io/name=rabbitmq --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running

services.name: Elasticsearch
services.abstract: RESTful search and analytics engine for all types of data
services.summary: Elasticsearch is a distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine capable of addressing a growing number of use cases. It centrally stores your data for lightning fast search and fine-tuned relevancy.
services.checkCommand: kubectl get pods -n default -l app=elasticsearch-master --no-headers 2>/dev/null | grep -q Running
